value: Begin
Continue
Settings
Quit
Master Volume
Now where should we begin?
At the beginning? Like, the very beginning? When Tessa created the world?
No, that’s a bit too… far back.
Instead, we’ll start where many stories begin, with a character.
Ball.
He was abandoned. Left to us in the dead of night. His parents gone.
Typical of Circles, you know. No responsibility.
So we took him in and raised him.
For years, we gave him everything our wonderful society had to offer.
A loving foster family. A school. A good life.
And how did he repay us? Did he become a productive member of society?
No!
He disappeared!
Ball left Los Angles sometime in the middle of his education.
Wasn't content, for whatever reason.
Ball bounced his way out. No obstacle could stop him.
He could scale many walls. A cube skill, but one Ball learned to fit in.
For all the good that did.
Ball had only one thing on his tiny, stupid mind. To leave. To run away.
Ah, the Hidden Shape. I was surprised Ball found it. He never struck me as all that clever.
But the real question is why. It didn’t make sense.
Cubes built this paradise, and yet Ball wanted nothing to do with it.
Maybe that was it. Raised by cubes, yes. But Ball was never really one of us.
He always stood out. It wasn’t just his appearance. He made himself stand out.
Even with all of our help, Ball was never good at fitting in.
Well, no use questioning the motives of a madman. There are far more productive ways to spend my time.
I thought that shape was hidden pretty well. I suppose I could be wrong, once in a while.
I'm glad he left, you know. All he ever did was burden us.
Go on, Ball. Get out of here. Never return.
Nobody wanted you. Nobody liked you.
Los Angles was a city for Cubes anyway. Not some Circle like you.
*ahem* Sorry, I was just talking to myself.
Those dirty Circles who left Ball on our doorstop. Who pushed their burden on us.
You know, it was never his home anyway. He didn’t belong here.
In fact, I suppose it was a favor of his, in some way. Leaving.
Where was Ball going, you ask?
Have you heard of Pyramid?
Land of the Triangles. Home of the laziest shapes you've ever met.
All talk, no action, those ones. Knowledge first, work second.
Why Ball sought them out, I'll never know.
But there he went. Gone. Never to return.
Thank Tessa, he's gone!
Ball would receive help no longer. He was on his own.
It was admittedly impressive. To find this hidden shape. Or perhaps just lucky.
